title: Yeah Right! handwritten script?
content:
Hi all,

This type appears in the Yeah Right! skate video (quality not fantastic from the screen grab) — lots of variation in the letters, so I'm guessing not a typeface. Any suggestions for something similar? Or indeed if it is a typeface, the one in question?

As always, thanks for the help!

Higashi

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [handscript.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/typophile.com/files/handscript.jpg) | 89.87 KB |
author: higashi

comments.content:
I think you're right that it is hand-drawn, but you can get a sort of similar bouncy connected script with [Emmascript Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-emmascript), maybe with some horizontal stretching added.

- Mike Yanega
It's not a typeface, it was hand lettered by artist [Evan Hecox](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/www.evanhecox.com/).

I recently gathered some of the better [handwritten scripts](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/handwriting_fonts.cfm) at FontShop.

Consider also [ITC Kick](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=ITC.10318.0.0) and [Whisk Broom](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822222631/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000090).
